column1: Easy Friends til the End Achievement
column4:
I'm looking to get the Friends til the End achievement. I've set up an AutoHotKey command that will auto-revive a player infinitely so I just need the players to stand around whilst I auto-revive one of you until the achievement pings for all of us.

I used the AutoHotKey command to get all the trust and confidence achievements; just set myself up near some Death Mist with another player, launch the command and go do something else for a couple hours.

I see no reason why that wouldn't work for Friends til the End. Everyone builds trust if I continually revive one character, I think.

Im based in the UK, but could potentially set it all up for people on NA time and just go back to bed. Anyone interested?

column1: Imagine thinking everyone forgot how bad your game is and still trying to sell it above $10
column4: Imagine dragons.

As much as I enjoy this game, it is more of a love/hate kind of relationship and that for one reason. The weapon gambling gimmick, Borderlands wannabe mask. I can have such an amazing experience here for a time, even an hour, yet daily I end up rage quitting for same reasons. Having only 3 weapon slots...
I loved these kinds of games since Thief TDP, Dishonored, Prey, as the immersion is the star of the show. I SO want it to be the same in Redfall, as there is so much going for this game, yet I continually get yanked out of the immersion because I need to keep switching my weapons around and often find myself in a surprise ambush by something I do not have a proper weapon equipped, and switching usually gets me quickly killed, and this after over 100 hours gameplay, I should be a pro. It feels like the monsters are getting stronger and I continually lag behind and have to roll for weapons just to have a more pleasant experience and not get killed every few minutes, and this on easiest difficulty.
I play games to relax, I get more than enough anxiety and stress from real life, and I can relax to a game like Thief Gold, or Dishonored and I can feel like a god there, like I earned my way to rule, I can feel zen, instead of continually struggling with no way out but quitting.
I guess it IS supposed to feel like a nightmare...

column1: Gave it time to cook and now...
column4:
I really enjoy it.

Introduction:

I'm a fan of Arkane games, though not what you would call a mega-fan. I've enjoyed everything they've done since Arx - but only a handful have been what I consider truly great. In fact, I think only Prey and perhaps Dishonored 2 take that honor for me, personally.

Anyway, I loved the concept of Redfall - and I happen to really have fun with most co-op looters - especially if there's an interesting setting and story involved. Redfall, to me, always seemed like it would be ideal for a good time.

So... Launch happens - and I tried the Gamepass version, just to make sure.

It wasn't pretty. In fact, it was so bad that I stopped playing after only 30 minutes or so - and I was highly sceptical it would ever improve enough to be worth my time.

Then, after the first patch - I gave it another shot and actually felt it was a pretty decent step up in overall quality. Still quite a ways from being a "good game" - but at least the concept was more or less proven.

I liked it enough to buy it on Steam. Not with the intention of playing it right away, but simply because I wanted to support the game - knowing how terrible the launch sales must have been.

I felt like it still needed a couple more patches to be truly worthwhile.

And here we are.

I have to say that this patch is pretty much everything I hoped for - barring some kind of miracle content drop.

They fixed all my major complaints, including:

Vacant town with way too few enemies.
Subpar performance with significant traversal stutters.
Lack of challenge due to terrible AI and pathing.
An almost unbelievable lack of a proper stealth takedown mechanic.
Overall lack of polish and too many visual glitches.

Yes, it's now in what I would call an acceptable, even decent, launch state.

Based on a handful of hours with this new patch, I'm ready to give this game a solid 7.5/10 - and potentially even higher if played with friends.

I doubt it will experience the kind of redemption arc that other games have in recent times, but I certainly hope more people will try it and give it the attention I truly believe it now deserves.

It's an original setting and it smacks of games like Secret World and movies like Lost boys. It has a bit of Fallout, a bit of Destiny and more than a bit of all the great Arkane games that we've come to appreciate over the years.
This game is awesome on my steam deck I need people to play with!

column1: Xbox vet Laura Fryer on why Xbox is failing
column4:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=69gs773bZRI
As to who she is:
"...an executive producer for Microsoft Games Studios, Fryer was responsible for shipping games for the Xbox and Windows platforms. Some of the titles she was involved with are the Gears of War games and Zoo Tycoon. She was one of the first members of Microsoft Game Studios (MGS) in 1995. As a producer, she shipped several games, including the classic Crimson Skies, and Fighter Ace, Microsoft's first massively multiplayer game. She also conceived and produced Microsoft's first release of Zone.com.

Prior to her return to MGS in 2004, Laura was the Director of the Xbox Advanced Technology Group, and a founding member of the Xbox project, which she joined in May 2000. During her tenure, she cultivated worldwide Xbox Developer Support, created the Xbox Advisory Board, and ran Xbox game developer events around the globe."
I hope this game has overhaul update

column1: Performance on Steam deck after the patch
column4: For those who are curious, After the update, I decided to download it again and give it another try. Performance wise, it has been improved dramatically. On medium setting, it holds constant 40 to 45 FPS. before on low it was having hard time holding 30s. I locked it to 40 FPS and had zero stutters. However that's it. I couldn't help myself to start playing again. It's still boring as hell, AI is better but still stupid as hell. This game was made to play with others and for single player, It's a thumbs down.

column1: After a long break, and now with the patch, much smoother for me
column4:
RTX 4080, AMD Ryzen 9 5900X, 120 Hz 4k monitor/OLED TV, DLSS set to quality, and image quality settings maxed out, IIRC. I'm now getting 120 fps almost all of the time, with the card not breaking a sweat, and set to a curve using 85% power.

Yadda yadda yadda, the smoother game play is helping with immersion, and I'm enjoying moving about the map, taking out baddies. I've been playing video games for a couple of decades, but not online ones, and I'm not what you'd call a natural born twitch game player. But I can usually do well playing shooters at medium difficulty settings, and occasionally with harder or maximum difficulty. Lol, though then I get killed a lot.

I mention that so as to emphasize that I'm something of "a tourist" with lots of games, and Redfall is pretty satisfying to me now, as a place to make excursions. Hopefully more improvements, and bonus content, are getting worked on.

P.S. I think some of the credit might be going to nVidia, for improving the DLSS implementation that the game uses.

Cheers!

column1: The Patch and my gaming Experience 10/10/23
column4:
Hey Devs,

Thank you for implementing this patch, as it did do a lot of good, and appreciate your continued hard work on it. Unfortunately, though I am still experiencing:

1. Stuttering especially when turning at rapid times or just coming back in to an area. It seems it's trying to reload, the area, I was just in, not sure on this.

2. Lots of freezing and lag when multiple enemies are on the screen, which usually ends up in my death since I can't see what's going on. Usually the vampires and there ability to traverse an area quickly, and surround me. Lots of freezing up on this one. 

3. Kill animations on vampires, usually staking, I get lots of lag or stuttering, even sometimes my screen freezes briefly. 

4. While picking up loot over a patch of red leaves, the red leaves looked distorted as if the textures aren't forming and essentially would disappear. 

5. and Finally, and I think that's why I'm having so many issues, is I think the game is using far more Video Memory than it should and it climbs, as I just tried to quit to desktop and my monitor went black for close to a minute, because I hear my PC trying to close the game. It seems there must be memory leak. 

My PC is no slump because usually I can run most current games on Epic/ Higher. PC Specs are below. 

Windows 10 x64 Pro 22H2
Gigabyte Technology
Z270X - Gaming 7
Intel Core I7 7700 @ 4.2ghz (8Cores)
16gig RAM
DX12
NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080Ti
Approximate Total Memory: 19210 MB
Display Memory: 11041 MB

I personally tried the new patch and its very good... Ish?~ Prior to this update I was getting sub 20 fps drops when moving around the game world every couple seconds on my 10900K / RTX 4080 configuration. This was a heavy CPU bottleneck due to the developers not understanding how to use UNREAL ENGINE 4 properly. 

However I can report that the game has improved significantly. Framerate is pretty much locked at my monitors refresh rate of 60. However some framedrops related to traversal are still there, with frametimes dropping to 60-100MS. This causes very harsh fps drops for a split second when entering a new traversal zone.

I have also observed a striking increase to VIDEO MEMORY. With the settings maxed out prior to this my GPU was using 9GB of video memory. However as of the latest patch the VRAM usage is at 14GB @ 4K resolution, MAX graphics, DLAA.
online matchmaking yet?

I'd like to think that there might be some path to redemption but I think we are past the point of no return for the whole studio, not just this trash game.

column1: Realistically what could they do to reboot this game into something worth recomending?
column4:
I see so many people here throwing out criticisms. I guess that is because many of us were really hyped about what this game could have been and also expected far more from a studio like Arkane.

I don't really see any strong suggestions through.

Aside from generic performance, matchmaking and bug fixing, what game-play changes and mechanics would you consider worth investing time in to turn this game into something that is worth playing or reccomending.

I can't really think of anything myself other than some sort of weapon crafting / leveling / upgrade system using scrap that you find around the place.

I'd also like to see the skill tree leveling made a bit faster so you can get access to the fun stuff way sooner.

I also think that in terms of endgame / longevity they could have made it feel a bit more like an extraction shooter but without the PVP.  But i'd love to see a risk v reward system where the longer you stay out the more dangerous the world gets but also the better the drops are.

You would then have various objectives to achieve before night fall. At night the word then gets even more dangerous but the loot gets better. However if you die you lose it iall.

Pretty generic though but at least something fun to play.

column1: No price slash despite the current Bethesda sale?
column4:
I'm a sucker for semi-♥♥♥♥ games, so I'm kind of tempted to pick this up - but absolutely NOT at £59.99, Arkane is huffing bath-salts if they think that sort of price is acceptable asking price for a game like this.

So imagine my surprise when I see the sale come up for assorted Bethesda titles and for some reason the likes of Fallout 4 and Wolfenstein The New Colossus - flawed but fun titles well worth their current heavily discounted asking prices - have a price-slash but this doesn't.

The team at Arkane need to get on the horn or do it themselves and cut the price to this and include it in the sale - I'd be willing to pay something like £20 which itself is extremely, extremely generous given the still god-awful state of this game, but no more than that.
Seriously now, do you guys think\/believe they will ever pull a No Man's Sky with this game? Or at the very it least make it decent like Cyberpunk did? I'm still really sad at this flop...

column1: Action games without STEALTH are super dumb  BRING BACK DISHONORED PLEASE.
column4:
You know, me and my two teenage sons - we keep playing Dishonored (especially the 1-st one cuz it's more artsy, each frame is a masterpiece of art).
Both games are timeless masterpieces. It's funny how games nowadays demand higher and higher specs while Dishonored 1 delivered all that gfx glory in 2011. Didn't age a bit. No posh glitz, artful restraint, 100% atmosphere, spartan and rich at the same time.

You know, if Dishonored 1 would be released now, and it would cost 300 dollars, I would pay that. Guaranteed. Because no other game offers that kind of experience. None. It's a gaping hole on the market full of screaming garbage.

Games nowadays offer you just killing. Just killing, killing, shooting, nothing else. This is so immensely stupid, dumb and... primitive. Uninteresting.

Dishonored offered so many options, including a totally harmless, non-lethal gameplay which was never less exciting than the violent one. THAT'S gold. That's pure, pure gold.
Please do the 3rd Dishonored in the cold and mysterious land Tyvia, as you once promised. And yes, you can charge as high as those wannabe titles charge (but never deliver on the promise).

column1: Lots of micro stutter on Radeon 6000
column4: It reminds me of the stuttering you'd get in Elder Scrolls IV (lol), but that was explained as being certain areas unloading and loading in the next chunk\/ grid. Graphics effects make no difference, or whether i'm running a mostly locked 120FPS, or 80FPS and unlocked. Either way the game just tanks to an immediate 41FPS then recover. You can turn around and run back and forth over the area that produced it and nothing, lending me to believe it's not to do with crossing over an area and loading in another. It just comes and goes, randomly. I even started installing most new games on my 2TB PCIE 4.0 NVME. Removed all overclocks on my CPU and GPU, clean installing (DDU'd) the latest Radeon drivers...same thing.

column1: How to get a stable & smooth 60FPS (w/ RTX 3070)
column4:
For anyone having framerate / stuttering (overall performance issues) here are the settings I have found to keep it at a *stable* & relatively *smooth* *60* *FPS*  

Change your monitor to 60 Hz (I tried 360 Hz & 180Hz but both produced poor results)
In Game turn on Vysnc & Nvidia control panel, turn on Vsync *FAST* mode
Reflex *ON + Boost* with Nvidia control panel having Low Latency set to *Ultra*
All settings on *high* with the exception being Effects & Shadows turned down to *medium*
*Turn off* DLSS/FSR and instead use TAA *High* (all forms of *upscaling* seem borderline broken atm, and should be avoided with the current day one patch)

(My rig is a laptop with an RTX 3070 + Ryzen 9 5900HX with 32GB of Dual Rank Ram)

I'm actually enjoying this game so far, but it does seem to be lacking depth (lore + world building)...hopefully the story gets more interesting as I progress (only a few hours in).  Either way, I think it's a fun game with a world that you can jump in & out of easily without needing much brainpower to follow the story, & have a good time alone or with friends.

column1: I am really worried that there will be no other games starring Layla
column4:
What is it about Layla that made me fall in love? Is it her powers? Is it her slender frame and large hands? Is it her rugged, capable appearance, or stellar personality? Is it her angular features? Either way, I knew Layla was the "girl for me" when I first saw her. 

But it looks like the expected Layla skin packs and voice packs are not coming out, and I'm at a loss for how to customize my Layla. I'm playing on the Xbox version of course, so you can't see that I have the game on Steam.

Is Layla...Dead in the water? Do you guys think she was popular enough to get her own solo game? I really hope so.

column1: All $70 games should fail this bad
column4: I'm shocked it's still this price. Even during the summer sale. Hopefully this abysmal failure will communicate to the industry that you can't release trash and think you'll get away with charging people elevated prices.

column1: [review, youtube.com] So, I've finally tried Redfall... || Late Night Gaming || Jun 28, 2023
column4: https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=-p-Tcuwl2Gs\n\nWhile I'm not entirely anti-Redfall, I watched many other review videos at release but this one nicely sums up certain things some weeks later, comparing it to many other games.
Hear me out... four words; 'Games as a Service'...

Bros talking about the price being reduced permanently and the game aint even on a temporary sale...I have hundreds of hours in satisfactory for like 1\/4 of the price of this game, I have I think less than 2 hours in Redfall.

I've been playing a fair bit of Redfall and I can say that it's a fine game.
It's not on the same level as Dishonored or Prey but, technical issues aside, it's not the disaster that many people claim it to be.

The world is fun to explore, same thing with destroying vampires.
Visual and audio design is great.

Many people seem to get an unhealthy kick out of bashing this game.
It's not a masterpiece but if you accept the premise, it will keep you entertained for 10-20 hours. 

Don't know how it plays in coop but in solo, I am having fun.

    Fixed an issue where interacting with certain Psychic Echoes would prevent them from playing again during a session
    Fixed an issue where successfully destroying a Nest was not awarding XP in single player sessions
    Also fixed an issue where successfully destroying a Nest was not increasing the Rook Storm meter
    Fixed an issue where certain Hero Abilities would prevent players from being able to stake the Black Sun
    Fixed an issue where Vampires would not correctly pursue players after teleporting in rapid succession

I'm finding the cost of recent Bethesda games getting too expensive to even buy.\n\nThe basic game for Redfall and Starfield is $120 AUD for the basic game itself and about $170 AUD for the special, I see people complaining about it being $70 to $80 USD, unless they add in seamless VR support for their games with no problems, I don't think I'll end up getting games from Bethesda anymore if they are costing that much for their games now, thanks for putting up with my rant.
lets not support these kind of developers please, let this game rot along with old expensive games.

column1: seriously arkane, fix your damn game
column4: nests give zero xp now, wtf.  i just tested this.  cleared a nest up to where you loot the heart, and i was at level 8 with just a sliver left until level 9.  looted the heart and then a few bags\/crates and then made it to the out and left with time to spare.  checked my xp after leaving, the stupid pop up window says +1000 xp, but my xp bar didn't move one single pixel.  how tf are you this bad at making games now?\nalso, stake ammo is completely broken.  you can't pick any up unless you're actively holding a stake launcher and refilling ammo at the station doesn't give you any unless you're also holding one, and even then it only gave me 3 total.  wasn't the max higher before the patch?  and i know it worked fine before the patch in terms of refilling and the max stake ammo count.

column1: Microsoft still refuses to close Arkane Austin, even after Redfall
column4: Xbox Game Studios chief Matt Booty told Axios (https:\/\/www.axios.com\/newsletters\/axios-gaming-859a2221-8d0f-4721-935b-0e87638a0280.html) that considers Redfall to be a \"good play\" on Xbox Gamepass and wants \"[i]to support them (Arkane Austin) to be able to keep working to deliver the game they had in mind[\/i]\". What is more importnat is that Matt refuses to shut down Arkane Austin, \"[i]That is the plan right now. They are hard at work on updates and continued content for Redfall[\/i]\". Which is not reassuring enough to me: without mentioning any long-term plans for the future of Arkane Austin, I wouldn't be shocked if Microsoft decided to [i]dissolve[\/i] Arkane Austin after finishing support for Redfall \u02d0sacrificed\u02d0. \nXbox Gamepass literally saving the skin of Arkane Austin (for now)! The lesson is: [b]Sign Gamepass[\/b] to keep giving good numbers to Redfall, or else... \u02d0theskull\u02d0

column1: Crashing to desktop or Bethesda.net crashes = Turn off VPN
column4: Been playing this on Gamepass and noticed a weird bug.  Every time you completed a section at the beginning when a video would play the video would crash half way with a Bethesda.net couldn't connect error.  This caused the Main Menu to look \"zoomed in\" and meeting the physician for the first time his character wasn't there but you could talk to him. \n Turned off VPN and it works good so far.

I can't believe that over a month of radio silence resulted in...this. Played with the patch for less than 2 hours tonight. In that short time frame?

-My framerate and graphical fidelity were both immediately and significantly worse.

-I got an infinite loading screen almost immediately. Weirdly, I never got those BEFORE they claimed to fix them.

-Rook Storm meter failed to increase upon nest completion.

-Rook failed to drop any loot upon defeat.

-Ammo reserves lowered/vanished for weapons I wasn't using. My pals noticed the same because  the devs just reduced the amount of stake launcher ammo you can carry and didn't mention it in the official patch notes. Because that's a cool thing to do.

Enemy names and health bars failed to appear for my buddies until they were within Shotgun range.

In the interest of fairness, the enemy increase was nice. Some of the new lighting and effects were nice. At one point there were like...20 cultists fighting one another. That's like...the only big positive. It's just frustrating to see a game release broken, have the developers go completely silent, then spring up with a patch that's impressive on paper and  worse in execution. I've given this game a lot of lukewarm defense, but I'm absolutely putting it down until I see a ton of new updates. How embarrassing for Arkane Austin, and absolutely terrible for people that actually paid $70 for this.
